column8: Description
column10: Edicts
column11: Anathema

column8: The Accidental God ascended from mortal life on a drunken dare. Cayden, the Drunken Hero, promotes freedom and encourages others to find their own path in life. He fights for just causes and delights in the best indulgences.
column10: drink, aid the oppressed, seek glory and adventure
column11: waste alcohol, be mean or standoffish when drunk, oppress the vulnerable

column8: Desna set her sights on the heavens, placing stars in the sky to guide travelers through the darkness and dreamers through nightmares. The Song of Spheres delights in freedom and mystery, and encourages her followers to do the same.
column10: aid fellow travelers, explore new places, express yourself through art and song, find what life has to offer
column11: cause fear or despair, cast, nightmare, or use similar magic to corrupt dreams, engage in bigoted behavior

column8: Long ago, Erastil was a horned god of the hunt, but his worship evolved to focus on rural communities. Old Deadeye desires nothing more than peaceful lives for his followers, calling them to arms only when that pastoral existence is threatened.
column10: care for your home and family, fulfill your duties, keep the peace, protect the community
column11: abandon your home in its time of need, choose yourself over your community, tarnish your reputation, tell lies

column8: Once a powerful angel and empyreal lord, Sarenrae led the charge to imprison Rovagug. The Dawnflower seeks to redeem evil where possible, burn it away with the fire of the sun when it can’t be redeemed, and restore those harmed by evil’s machinations.
column9: healing, honest redemption, and the sun
column10: destroy the Spawn of Rovagug, protect allies, provide aid to the sick and wounded, seek and allow redemption
column11: create undead, lie, deny a repentant creature an opportunity for redemption, fail to strike down evil

column8: Shelyn, the Eternal Rose, promotes peace and love, and she encourages her followers to create beauty in a sometimes-dark world. She seeks to one day redeem her corrupted brother, Zon-Kuthon.
column10: be peaceful, choose and perfect an art, lead by example, see the beauty in all things
column11: destroy art or allow it to be destroyed, unless saving a life or pursuing greater art; refuse to accept surrender

column8: Although revered by many dwarves as the Father of Creation, Torag strives to protect every community where he is worshipped and is also followed by those who treasure crafting and creation.
column10: be honorable and forthright, keep your word, respect the forge, serve your people
column11: tell lies or cheat someone, intentionally create inferior works, show continued mercy to the enemies of your people when such enemies prove they are undeserving

column8: This shadowy figure is worshipped in four aspects: Blackfingers, ally of alchemists and poisoners; the murderous Father Skinsaw; the thieving Gray Master; and the secretive Reaper of Reputation.
column10: keep your true identity secret, sacrifice anyone necessary, take every advantage in a fight, work from the shadows
column11: allow your true identity to be connected to your foul dealings, share a secret freely, show mercy

column8: Once a god of art, beauty, and music, like Shelyn, the Midnight Lord returned from a sojourn in the dark spaces between the planes horribly changed. Zon-Kuthon now teaches the pleasures of pain and darkness.
column10: bring pain to the world, mutilate your body
column11: create permanent or long-lasting sources of light, provide comfort to those who suffer

column8: Prior to her ascension and inheritance of many of the god of humanity’s worshippers, Iomedae was a holy warrior in wars against the undead. The Inheritor upholds the values of virtue, fighting against the wicked and unjust.
column10: be temperate, fight for justice and honor, hold valor in your heart
column11: abandon a companion in need, dishonor yourself, refuse a challenge from an equal

column8: Asmodeus, Prince of Darkness, delights in tempting mortals to give in to corruption. He promotes hierarchies where everyone knows their place, and he takes advantage of order for his own selfish benefit.
column10: negotiate contracts to your best advantage, rule tyrannically and torture weaker beings, show subservience to your betters
column11: break a contract, share power with the weak, insult Asmodeus by showing mercy to your enemies
column12: any (characters who commit themselves to Asmodeus this way have their souls bound to the Dark Prince for all eternity)

column8: Rovagug, the Rough Beast, was long ago imprisoned within Golarion’s core at the hands of many other deities working in concert, and he seeks to one day break free and wreak havoc upon the world. He is served by his spawn and those who seek the ultimate destruction of all things.
column10: destroy all things, free Rovagug from his prison
column11: create something new, let material ties restrain you, torture a victim or otherwise delay its destruction

column8: So infatuated with the pleasures of the living world, Urgathoa escaped the clutches of death and the afterlife, becoming the first undead. The Pallid Princess now revels in the sharing of her hedonistic ways and spreading undeath.
column10: become undead upon death, create or protect the undead, sate your appetites
column11: deny your appetites, destroy undead, sacrifice your life

column8: A deity of two aspects, Gozreh is the sea that encapsulates the land and the wind that moves its surface. The Wind and the Waves are popular with druids and those who seek to preserve the wilds.
column10: cherish, protect, and respect nature in all its forms
column11: bring civilization to intrude on the wild, create undead, despoil areas of natural beauty

column8: Ancient and powerful beyond even most other gods, Pharasma judges the souls of all who perish from her throne in the Boneyard. Through these judgments, the Lady of Graves ensures that the natural cycle of birth and death—the River of Souls—is not disrupted.
column9: birth, death, fate, prophecy, and time
column10: strive to understand ancient prophecies, destroy undead, lay bodies to rest
column11: create undead, desecrate a corpse, rob a tomb

column8: Abadar, Master of the First Vault, seeks to bring civilization to the wilds of the world, encourages adherence to the law, and promotes commerce and trade within civilization. He also encourages cooperation among ancestries.
column10: bring civilization to the frontiers, earn wealth through hard work and trade, follow the rule of law
column11: engage in banditry or piracy, steal, undermine a law-abiding court

column8: Calistria, the Savored Sting, is a mischievous and mercurial god of attraction who delights in tricking others and seeks vengeance on those who slight her. Though Calistria is most widely worshipped by elves, members of many other ancestries follow her as well.
column10: pursue your personal freedom, seek hedonistic thrills, take revenge
column11: become too consumed by love or a need for revenge, let a slight go unanswered

column8: Anyone who seeks glory on the battlefield calls out prayers to Our Lord in Iron. Gorum emphasizes might, encouraging his followers to seek out war and combat as the ultimate way to worship him.
column10: attain victory in fair combat, push your limits, wear armor in combat
column11: kill prisoners or surrendering foes, prevent conflict through negotiation, win a battle through underhanded tactics or indirect magic

column8: As a mortal, Irori attained true enlightenment, allowing him to break free of the shackles of mortality and achieve divinity. As a god, he is the Master of Masters and promotes discipline and teaches that one who can master themself finds the greatest benefits the world can provide.
column10: be humble; help others perfect themselves; hone your body, mind, and spirit to a more perfect state; practice discipline
column11: engage in overly unhealthy or self-destructive behaviors, destroy an important historical text, repeatedly fail to maintain self-control

column8: Lamashtu, the Mother of Monsters, revels in corruption of the pure. The physical changes and nightmares left by her interventions are treated as gifts by her followers and unwelcome terrors by the outside world. There are some that find respite or even a family among Lamashtu’s followers due to the faith’s greater acceptance of differences.
column10: bring power to outcasts and the downtrodden, indoctrinate others in Lamashtu’s teachings, make the beautiful monstrous, reveal the corruption and flaws in all things
column11: attempt to change that which makes you different, provide succor to Lamashtu’s enemies

column8: Once a mortal master of magic, Nethys sought to unlock all the secrets of the planes, ascending to godhood as his mind truly understood the entire potential of magic. The All-Seeing Eye is a dualistic god, teaching both the destructive and protective potential of magic.
column10: seek out magical power and use it
column11: pursue mundane paths over magical ones
column13: 1st:force barrage, 2nd:embed message, 3rd:levitate, 4th:flicker, 5th:telekinetic haul, 6th:wall of force, 7th:warp mind, 8th:quandary, 9th:detonate magic

column8: Beraur's leads the way to the end of the tunnel, the path back to forgiveness and civilization. The Cleansing Light seeks to bring order to chaos and purity to corruption. His followers are occasionally accused of overzealousness when they burn away the rot.
column10: seek out and challenge oppressors and tyrants, defend friends and the innocent
column11: suffer a bully’s insults to you or another without retort, abandon a friend in need
column20: Hucaen City,Otari,Timbermont,Tawdryquay,Willowglade,Bovinslate,Bridgegrove,Corsabell,Haven,Lamarich Key,Skelnelly Manor,The Anchor Archipelago,Brentram Island,Fomatroy,Tanidam

column8: Duella watches over the people of Hucaen as they sleep and dream. The Dream Dweller is not to be trifled with, however - she can just as easily give nightmares as peaceful sleep. Some say the stars in the sky are individual dreams.
column10: always make time for sleeping and dreams, ensure others never go to sleep scared
column11: stay up all night without any breaks for sleeping or dreaming, attack a person or creature while they sleep

column8: Ghadea presides over any artful creation, from grand symphonies and towering statues to fashionable clothes and . The Cosmic Artist is invoked in the construction of many things, from a simple horseshoe to the factories and towers of Smackels-on-the-River.
column10: choose and perfect an art, lead by example, respect the forge
column11: destroy art or allow it to be destroyed, unless saving a life or pursuing greater art; intentionally create inferior works,

column8: Grianke embodies balance, truth, and justice. The Eternal Judge's wants to root out corruption and injustice everywhere. His followers accomplish this by direct action or exposing it for the public to take action.
column10: be humble; help others perfect themselves; hone your body, mind, and spirit to a more perfect state;
column11: become addicted to a substance, refuse a challenge from an equal, repeatedly fail to maintain self-control

column8: Jevitras searches for new knowledge and new magic relentlessly. The Keen Librarian has directed their followers to build libraries and laboratories Instead of temples. They prefer if people don't get hurt in the process, but only so much.
column10: seek out magical power and use it
column11: pursue mundane paths over magical ones

column8: Qhontia presides over the cycle of death and birth, from death in combat and old age, to reincarnation, all the way on down to compost. They make sure the cycle continues - things must die to make room for things to be born.
column10: Recycle rot and waste into useful creations, shock the self-righteous, destroy undead
column11: waste food or good materials, allow rot to poison an area, create undead
column13: 1st: pest form, 2nd: one with plants, 7th: execute
column20: Smackels-on-the-River,Rockyville,Pewterhaunt,Salsbar,Harkinbluff,Bovinslate,Bridgegrove,Earthenwind,Qhontia's Bounty,Lamarich Key,Nilsethemar,The Anchor Archipelago,Brentram Island,Quelkha,Raqnim's Riders,Tanidam

column8: Solous enjoys all things that sow discord - friends falling out over a misunderstanding, a mark falling hard for a particularly nasty con, and anything that undermines authority. The Savage Wild will happily bring down a town or even a city towards this end.
column10: embarrass and expose hypocrites, humble those in power, play pranks and practical jokes
column11: show remorse for your pranks, take a joke personally

column8: Taveyar believes that might makes right. The Dread Archduke has fans in all levels of many heirarchies, particularly military ones. His preferred method of worship is via combat, and is not known for mercy.
column10: veil your motives, make dangerous deals, speak with refinement
column11: cower from fights, neglect your defenses, betray a lover
column13: 1st: hydraulic push, 4th: vision of death, 9th: massacre

column8: Renza fiercely protects those she loves, and those in need. The Blood Risen is strong emotion and adrenaline personified: She loves the thrill of combat, of love, of righteous fury.
column10: do whatever it takes to survive
column11: allow others to slight you without retaliation, forgive those who have wronged you, sacrifice others in your place
column13: 1st: pummeling rubble, 2nd: blood vendetta, 3rd: vampiric feast
column20: Smackels-on-the-River,Otari,Pewterhaunt,Salsbar,Cherryhaunt,Makarine's Vigilance,Chobrazkad,Makarine's Glory,The Anchor Archipelago,Werronga,Brentram Island,Fomatroy,Makarine's Thirst,Raqnim's Riders

column8: Lathas promises that anything is possible if you work hard enough. The Sweat Broken smiles upon those who toil, cities, and amassed wealth. They prefer worship in the form of creation for a purpose, though they do not look down upon art.
column10: continually improve your abilities, work ceaselessly, express yourself through craft, provide necessities and protection for those in need
column11: fail to work toward goals or grow in skill, relax excessively or give into sloth
column13: 1st: temporary tool, 4th: weapon storm, 7th: duplicate foe

column8: Taszia ushers the dead to a peaceful rest, and abhors anything that interferes, especially the undead. The Tears Wept mourn for those who have died, and those he knows will die. He is cursed with the knowledge of the future, and shares in the form of prophecy.
column10: lay bodies to rest, aid fellow travelers, explore new places
column11: make decisions erratically or randomly, desecrate a corpse, rob a tomb, engage in banditry or piracy

column17: earth, water, fire, air, metal, wood, lightning, cold
